alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Barnwell; Fairfield; Kershaw; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Southern Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 12:21PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Fairfield, southwestern Lancaster, northeastern Barnwell, Lexington, eastern Aiken, northwestern Orangeburg, northwestern Richland and northwestern Kershaw Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1220 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Blackstock to near Savannah River Site. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Winnsboro, Springdale, St. Andrews, Dentsville, Oak Grove, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, Williston, Blackville, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, New Ellenton, Gaston and Arcadia Lakes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 35 and 74. Interstate 26 between mile markers 92 and 119. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 3, and between mile markers 18 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.

area.areaDesc: Aiken; Barnwell; Fairfield; Kershaw; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Southern Lancaster
